channel.title: Software on Kyle Rassweiler
channel.description: Recent content in Software on Kyle Rassweiler

item.title: Arch Snapper BTRFS Install Guide
item.description:
This guide is for installing arch linux (UEFI) with:

  • BTRFS file system including subvolumes.
  • Snapper.
  • Snap-pac-grub.
  • Bootable snapshots.
  • Qemu/kvm with iommu setup.
  • Linux/Windows Gaming.

item.title: Kawasaki As Parser
item.description: A Kawasaki robot backup parser written in TypeScript for browser or Node. The library also includes TypeScript interfaces for use in new projects.

item.title: KRello
item.description:
A simple clone of the well known kanban system Trello. Currently there isn’t a database attached beyond the react browser, but the user is able to add boards and cards.

There is also drag-n-drop functionality.

item.title: Daily Driver Challenge Hard(er) Mode Part 0
item.description: The Linus Tech Tips Daily Driver Challenge is an attempt at using a linux system as your main rig. The hard(er) mode version is using Arch and i3wm as the os of choice.

item.title: Robot Project Utility
item.description:
A robot project utility written in JS, HTML, CSS, React, and Electron.

The utility helps prepare robot related project work, and view/compare robot backup data.

item.title: KR Display
item.description: A Metor based application for displaying production data from an SQL server.

item.title: Node SCADA System
item.description: As the name implies it is a SCADA system written in js(Node.js), the system uses the mcprotocol to communicate with a Mitsubishi PLC, uses Jade for templates, and express for routing.

item.title: Genetic Algorithm
item.description: A simple genetic algorithm written in modern C++ used to better understand vectors and smart pointers

item.title: Arch Snapper BTRFS Install Guide - Script Method
item.description:
This guide is for installing arch linux (UEFI) using a script with:

  • BTRFS file system including subvolumes.
  • Snapper.
  • Snap-pac-grub.
  • Bootable snapshots.
  • Qemu/kvm with iommu setup.
  • Linux/Windows Gaming.

item.title: Code Camp 1
item.description: Part 1 of the Free Code Camp Campaign, all about responsive web design.
